medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain was dull, initially radiating from the throat to the epigastrium and subsequently across the chest. It was associated with diaphoresis and nausea. During ambulance transport, the patient developed bradycardia and hypotension, with pulse rates falling to 34 beats/min and blood pressure as low as 60/40 mm Hg.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, diabetes, and hyperlipidemia; no documented previous coronary artery disease or coagulation abnormality.
medical_history.family_history: Positive for atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease and stroke.
